channel.title: A little realistic mouse challenge
channel.description:
hi all, ive been trying to make an ideal mouse movement script that wont get my ass banned. Now i only run it for one hour a day or so to make sure its not the time online im playing, and im still being banned. What i have included so far. -lots of different methods of emulating mouse movements, from a random line, to fitting quadratic, cupic, and quartic curves, lines that accelerate and decelerate, a combination of practically everything. -off action movement (follow random objects and ppl while the scipt is waiting, example, mining) -hover above next target (when mining, the thing anticipates where the next ore will come back) -random numbers in every action -pauses during movement -overshooting target -different speeds and acceleration
and, the sad thing is, 400 lines of script later and im still being banned.
recently, i came up with a new approach tho, instead of using numbers and complicated calculations to find different curves, ive decided to try make a mouse function that uses almost entirely logical opperaters. Theres still some adding and subtracting involved, but i dont try fit any curves, calculate the slope that the mouse has to move.
My challenge basically is to build perfect mouse movement script that wont get banned. (besides im pretty sure that right now they have a different tactic of getting scar uses banned, cause my current mouse movements are pretty damn good). O well, to break it down, i need suggestions on how to make my mouse movements better.

item.description:
@_DEAD wrote:

i cant seem to find the includes for srl, i have the main include, but i cant find all the little ones that go with it. Anyway, i do want to have a look at it. Right now, ive almost got the basic structure of my mouse down, its like a homing missile, which means u can bump it randomly into a different direction, and it will correct itself.

Read full topic

item.title: A little realistic mouse challenge
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

Looks pretty cool. You never answered my question. Have you ever seen, or used Bens Algorithm Spline Mouse? It is the best mosue we have, maybe you should check it out. Nice work by the way.

Also, Jagex does not detect your Mouse Movements unless your flagged I have been told by trusted sources.

Read full topic

item.title: A little realistic mouse challenge
item.dc:creator: @_DEAD *DEAD*
item.description:
@_DEAD wrote:

interesting. im new to runescape, but not cheating. ive read all about how good rune scape is at banning ppls, and i sorta challenged myself to build an unbannable script. Theres probally one thing im doing wrong, and its probally catching them all out. I though that with all the anti cheating buzz and the tracing mouse movements i thought fagex would atleast be smart enough to do simple linear regressions, measure distance between mouse movements each time theyre checked to look for a consistancy, or atleast look for instant teleportations of the mouse. Obviously not, im curious as to what does ban me then. Lol. Actually, do u think rs is more likely to pull a mass ban to catch all those who trade with their mains, rather than ban characters as they come. Maybe thats why their not getting banned. I forgot to mention that all characters were banned during the mass ban not to long ago, and i havent started up again yet. Still building my mouse script.

O, btw, this will sorta be cool for anyone who cares. I started my mouse script this morning, and ill show u guys what ive got so far.

program New;
var
   x,y,curangle:integer;
   i,j:extended;

function abs(i : extended) : extended;
begin
     i:= sqrt(i*i);
     result := i;
end;
   
function fact(i : integer) : integer;
var
   holdi,res : integer;
begin
     holdi := i;
     res := 1;
     for i := 1 to holdi do
     begin
          res := i * res
     end;
     result := res;
end;
   
function arctan(e : extended) : extended;
var
   count : integer;
   res : extended;
   inv : boolean;
begin
     if(abs(e) > 1)then
     begin
          e := pow(e,-1);
          inv := true;
     end else
     begin
          inv := false;
     end;
     for count := 0 to 6 do
     begin
          res := res + ( ( pow(2,2 * count) * pow(fact(count),2) ) / fact(2 * count + 1) ) *  ( ( pow(e,2*count+1) ) / ( pow(1 + pow(e,2),count + 1) ) );
     end;
     if(inv)then
     begin
          res := 1.5707963267 - res;
     end;
     result := res;
end;

procedure findintercept(targx,targy,radius:integer);
var
   m:extended;
begin
     if(i = 0) or (j = 0)then
     begin
          if(i = 0)then
          begin
               y:= y + radius;
          end else
          begin
               x:= x + radius;
          end;
     end else
     begin
          m:= i / j;
          x:= x + round(sqrt((radius * radius)/(m*m+1)));
          y:= y + round(sqrt(m*m)*sqrt((radius * radius)/(m*m+1)));
     end;
end;

procedure adjangle(targx,targy,rate:integer);
var
   targangle,degrees:integer;
   radians:extended;
begin
     if(targx - x = 0) or (targy - y = 0)then
     begin
          if(targx - x = 0)then
          begin
               if(targy - y > 0)then
               begin
                    targangle:= 270;
               end else
               begin
                    targangle:= 90;
               end;
          end;
          if(targy - y = 0)then
          begin
               if(targx - x > 0)then
               begin
                    targangle:= 180;
               end else
               begin
                    targangle:= 0;
               end;
          end;
     end else
     begin
          degrees:= round(arctan(sqrt((x - targx)/(y - targy)*(x - targx)/(y - targy))) * 180 / pi);
          if(targx - x < 0)then
          begin
               if(targy - y < 0)then
               begin
                    targangle:= 270 - degrees;
               end else
               begin
                    targangle:= 90 + degrees;
               end;
          end else
          begin
               if(targy - y < 0)then
               begin
                    targangle:= 270 + degrees;
               end else
               begin
                    targangle:= 90 - degrees;
               end;
          end;
     end;
     if(round(abs(curangle - targangle)) > 180)then
     begin
          curangle:= curangle - 360;
     end;
     if(curangle <> targangle)then
     begin
          if(curangle > targangle)then
          begin
               curangle:= curangle - rate;
          end else
          begin
               curangle:= curangle + rate;
          end;
     end;
     if(curangle < 0)then
     begin
          curangle:= curangle + 360;
     end;
     radians:= curangle * pi / 180;
     i:= sin(radians);
     j:= cos(radians);
     writeln(inttostr(curangle));
     writeln(inttostr(degrees));
     writeln(inttostr(targangle));
end;
procedure tomouse(targx,targy,radius,square:integer);
begin
     getmousepos(x,y);
     repeat
     adjangle(targx,targy,10);
     findintercept(targx,targy,radius);
     x:= round(x + random(square) - 0.5 * square);
     y:= round(y + random(square) - 0.5 * square);
     movemouse(x,y);
     wait(10);
     until(y > targy);
     writeln('y=' + inttostr(y) + 'targy=' + inttostr(targy));
end;
begin
curangle:= 90;
x:=100
y:=100
holdmouse(100,100,true);
tomouse(800,600,20,4);
releasemouse(x,y,true);

//adjangle(120,120,20);
end.

dont be too expectant of it, but there are a few things you can play around with. This is a different mouse system than the ones ive seen in the past. Its based around logic, not complex equations. As youll probally see, the core of the mouse movement is really really simple, but the other parts arent quite so simple. U can play around with a few things. In the main loop, you can change curangle. this is effectively the start angle, and the script will work from this angle and adjust itself until it hits the target angle. Then theres rate, which affects how many degrees it can turn at a time. It still needs lots of work, but open up paint and let it draw u a line

Read full topic

item.title: A little realistic mouse challenge
item.dc:creator: @roberty_bob roberty bob
item.description:
@roberty_bob wrote:

mouse mousement doesn’t alert the banning system on it’s own. At SRL, we have many recent examples of scripts running nonstop for dozens upon dozens of hours without ban. Banning is by reporting and cyclic repetition. I have run scripts for 24 hours straight where the mouse has been moving like lightning in straight lines… not a single character banned from those 10 characters to this day.

Read full topic

item.title: A little realistic mouse challenge
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

Good luck! I don’t have any suggestions, but have you tried Ben’s mouse from SRL?

Read full topic
